Sentencas: The oxygen electrodes from two solid oxide electrolysis stacks that performed high-temperature steam electrolysis (HTSE) and produced hydrogen for 1000 and 2000 h, respectively, were examined using X-ray fluorescence, X-ray absorption near edge structure (XANES), four-point resistivity, scanning electron microscopy, energy dispersive spectroscopy, X-ray diffraction and Raman micro-spectroscopy to determine possible causes for the degradation in stack performance over the test periods.
Titulo: Post-test evaluation of oxygen electrodes from solid oxide electrolysis stacks

Sentencas: These techniques yielded information such as elemental distribution, oxidation state, phases present, electrode delamination, and porosity within the electrode layers.
Titulo: Post-test evaluation of oxygen electrodes from solid oxide electrolysis stacks

Sentencas: From these studies, we found two phenomena that were likely the cause of increasingly poor oxygen electrode performance over time.
Titulo: Post-test evaluation of oxygen electrodes from solid oxide electrolysis stacks

Sentencas: The first source of degradation was chromium substitution into the oxygen electrode bond layer, which serves to bond the cell to the flow field and interconnect.
Titulo: Post-test evaluation of oxygen electrodes from solid oxide electrolysis stacks

Sentencas: This is caused by migration of a chromium species from the bipolar plate.
Titulo: Post-test evaluation of oxygen electrodes from solid oxide electrolysis stacks

Sentencas: The effect of this is a significant increase in the electrical resistance of the bond layer material.
Titulo: Post-test evaluation of oxygen electrodes from solid oxide electrolysis stacks

Sentencas: The other source of degradation identified was oxygen electrode delamination.
Titulo: Post-test evaluation of oxygen electrodes from solid oxide electrolysis stacks

Sentencas: The cause of electrode delamination, which is locally catastrophic to the operation of the cell, is unclear; however, we will discuss two possible mechanisms that might cause this phenomenon.
Titulo: Post-test evaluation of oxygen electrodes from solid oxide electrolysis stacks
